presenter.name: Gwang Ha Kim
presenter.title: Pusan National University
presenter.bio: EUS for subepithelial lesions : non-invasive approach

slide.title: EUS for subepithelial lesions : non-invasive approach
slide.titleNormalized: eus for subepithelial lesions : non-invasive approach
slide.notes: Thank you for you kind introduction. The title I speak today is EUS for subepithelial lesion: non-invasive approach.
slide.notesNormalized: thank you for you kind introduction. the title i speak today is eus for subepithelial lesion: non-invasive approach.
slide.notesHtml:
Thank you for you kind introduction.

The title I speak today is EUS for subepithelial lesion: non-invasive approach.
slide.text: EUS for subepithelial lesions : non-invasive approach Department of Internal Medicine Pusan National University School of Medicine Gwang Ha Kim

slide.title: Subepithelial lesion (SEL)
slide.notes: Instead of subepithelial lesion, we usually use a term “submucosal tumor (SMT).” Due to the increase of health check-up endoscopy, the incidence of subepithelial lesion is increasing.
slide.notesNormalized: instead of subepithelial lesion, we usually use a term “submucosal tumor (smt).” due to the increase of health check-up endoscopy, the incidence of subepithelial lesion is increasing.
slide.notesHtml:
Instead of subepithelial lesion, we usually use a term “submucosal tumor (SMT).”

Due to the increase of health check-up endoscopy, the incidence of subepithelial lesion is increasing.
slide.text: Subepithelial lesion (SEL) Submucosal tumor Spectrum of histologic lesions located beneath the mucosal lining of GI tract Relatively common finding at upper endoscopy 1.7% (194/11,712) Korean J Gastroenterol 2015;25:274

slide.title: What do we worry about in SEL?
slide.titleNormalized: what do we worry about in sel?
slide.notes: If we meet the subepithelial lesion in clinics, we worry about whether it is benign or malignant.
slide.notesNormalized: if we meet the subepithelial lesion in clinics, we worry about whether it is benign or malignant.
slide.notesHtml: If we meet the subepithelial lesion in clinics, we worry about whether it is benign or malignant.
slide.text: What do we worry about in SEL? Benign (>85%) Malignant (<15%)

slide.title: Diagnostic weapons for SELs
slide.notes: There are several diagnostic modalities for subepithelial lesions. Today, I focus on the diagnostic EUS.
slide.notesNormalized: there are several diagnostic modalities for subepithelial lesions. today, i focus on the diagnostic eus.
slide.notesHtml:
There are several diagnostic modalities for subepithelial lesions.

Today, I focus on the diagnostic EUS.
slide.text: Diagnostic weapons for SELs Endoscopy Biopsy EUS EUS-guided tissue acquisition Endoscopic resection

slide.title: EUS (Endoscopic ultrasonography)
slide.notes: As you know, EUS has the merits of endoscopy and ultrasonography. During EUS, we can get some information from the endoscopic findings of subepithelial lesions.
slide.notesNormalized: as you know, eus has the merits of endoscopy and ultrasonography. during eus, we can get some information from the endoscopic findings of subepithelial lesions.
slide.notesHtml:
As you know, EUS has the merits of endoscopy and ultrasonography.

During EUS, we can get some information from the endoscopic findings of subepithelial lesions.
slide.text: EUS (Endoscopic ultrasonography) Endoscopy GI tract surface image Ultrasonography Image of GI wall & adjacent extramural structures High resolution image in near field with limited penetration depth (1-2 cm to 5-6 cm)

slide.title: What do we examine the SEL features ?
slide.titleNormalized: what do we examine the sel features ?
slide.notes: At that time, we must get information such location, shape, color, surface, mobility, consistency and size. Of them, I focus on the location, color and surface.
slide.notesNormalized: at that time, we must get information such location, shape, color, surface, mobility, consistency and size. of them, i focus on the location, color and surface.
slide.notesHtml:
At that time, we must get information such location, shape, color, surface, mobility, consistency and size.

Of them, I focus on the location, color and surface.
slide.text:
What do we examine the SEL features ? Location Shape Color Surface Mobility Consistency Size
`

slide.title: Frequency of SELs according to location (PNUH)
slide.titleNormalized: frequency of sels according to location (pnuh)
slide.notes: This slide shows the frequency of SELs according to the location. This is my experience. Leiomyoma usually locates in the cardia, GIST and schwannoma locate mainly in the body, and glomus tumor and ectopic pancreas are usually present at the antrum.
slide.notesNormalized: this slide shows the frequency of sels according to the location. this is my experience. leiomyoma usually locates in the cardia, gist and schwannoma locate mainly in the body, and glomus tumor and ectopic pancreas are usually present at the antrum.
slide.notesHtml:
This slide shows the frequency of SELs according to the location. This is my experience.

Leiomyoma usually locates in the cardia, GIST and schwannoma locate mainly in the body, and glomus tumor and ectopic pancreas are usually present at the antrum.
slide.text: Frequency of SELs according to location (PNUH) IFP Lipoma Glomus tumor Ectopic pancreas Granular cell tumor Leiomyoma Carcinoid tumor Duplication cyst GIST Schwannoma Gastritis cystica profunda MALToma

slide.title: Color of SELs
slide.notes: Color is also important. Most subepithelial lesions has similar color to the surrounding normal mucosa. If the color of tumor is yellowish, we assume the lesion is lipoma or granular cell tumor. If the color is translucent, the lesions may be cystic lesion including GCP or BGH. If the color is bluish, the lesions may be AV malformation such as hemangioma or varices.
slide.notesNormalized: color is also important. most subepithelial lesions has similar color to the surrounding normal mucosa. if the color of tumor is yellowish, we assume the lesion is lipoma or granular cell tumor. if the color is translucent, the lesions may be cystic lesion including gcp or bgh. if the color is bluish, the lesions may be av malformation such as hemangioma or varices.
slide.notesHtml:
Color is also important.

Most subepithelial lesions has similar color to the surrounding normal mucosa.

If the color of tumor is yellowish, we assume the lesion is lipoma or granular cell tumor.

If the color is translucent, the lesions may be cystic lesion including GCP or BGH.

If the color is bluish, the lesions may be AV malformation such as hemangioma or varices.
slide.text: Color of SELs Normal/Yellow/Translucent/Bluish

slide.title: Surface of SELs
slide.notes: The surface of subepithelial lesions are also important. If the lesion has umbilication, the lesion is ectopic pancreas. When the tiny opening is found at the surface, the lesion might be gastritis cystica profunda or BGH. If the tumor has definite erosion or ulceration, the possibility of malignance increases such as in NET, SMT-like carcinoma, or GIST.
slide.notesNormalized: the surface of subepithelial lesions are also important. if the lesion has umbilication, the lesion is ectopic pancreas. when the tiny opening is found at the surface, the lesion might be gastritis cystica profunda or bgh. if the tumor has definite erosion or ulceration, the possibility of malignance increases such as in net, smt-like carcinoma, or gist.
slide.notesHtml:
The surface of subepithelial lesions are also important.

If the lesion has umbilication, the lesion is ectopic pancreas.

When the tiny opening is found at the surface, the lesion might be gastritis cystica profunda or BGH.

If the tumor has definite erosion or ulceration, the possibility of malignance increases such as in NET, SMT-like carcinoma, or GIST.
slide.text: Surface of SELs Dimpling/Umbilication/Opening/Erosion/Ulcer

slide.title: Normal gut wall
slide.notes: On EUS, normal gut wall consists of 5 layers. With using high-frequency EUS, the gut wall consists of 9 layers.
slide.notesNormalized: on eus, normal gut wall consists of 5 layers. with using high-frequency eus, the gut wall consists of 9 layers.
slide.notesHtml:
On EUS, normal gut wall consists of 5 layers.

With using high-frequency EUS, the gut wall consists of 9 layers.
slide.text: Normal gut wall Normal esophageal wall (20 MHz) 1,2 epithelium 3 lamina propria 4 muscularis mucosa 5 submucosa 6 inner circular muscle 7 intermuscular connective tissue 8 outer longitudinal muscle 9 adventitia Normal gastric wall (7.5 MHz) fluid-mucosa interface mucosa submucosa muscularis propria subserosa/serosa

slide.title: What features should we describe?
slide.notes: During EUS, we must get information such as ….
slide.notesNormalized: during eus, we must get information such as ….
slide.notesHtml: During EUS, we must get information such as ….
slide.text: What features should we describe? Location layer Echogenicity Homogeneity Marginal border clarity Growth pattern Size Presence cystic change hyperechogenic spots calcification marginal halo

slide.title: SELs : 2nd layer
slide.notes: From now, I will show you typical EUS cases. First is the lesion located in the 2nd hypoechoic layer. These cases are diagnosed as leiomyoma, granular cell tumor, carcinoid tumor an so on.
slide.notesNormalized: from now, i will show you typical eus cases. first is the lesion located in the 2nd hypoechoic layer. these cases are diagnosed as leiomyoma, granular cell tumor, carcinoid tumor an so on.
slide.notesHtml:
From now, I will show you typical EUS cases.

First is the lesion located in the 2nd hypoechoic layer.

These cases are diagnosed as leiomyoma, granular cell tumor, carcinoid tumor an so on.
slide.text: SELs : 2nd layer Leiomyoma Granular cell tumor Inflammatory fibrinoid polyp Carcinoid tumor MALT lymphoma Brunner’s gland hyperplasia

slide.title: SELs : 2nd and 3rd layer
slide.notes: Sometimes the afore-mentioned lesions are also located in the 2nd and 3rd layer.
slide.notesNormalized: sometimes the afore-mentioned lesions are also located in the 2nd and 3rd layer.
slide.notesHtml: Sometimes the afore-mentioned lesions are also located in the 2nd and 3rd layer.
slide.text: SELs : 2nd and 3rd layer Granular cell tumor Inflammatory fibrinoid polyp Carcinoid tumor MALT lymphoma Ectopic pancreas Brunner’s gland hyperplasia

slide.title: Granular cell tumor vs Leiomyoma
slide.notes: At first, the leiomyoma is seen as hypoechoic lesion with clear margin in 2nd layer. Granular cell tumor also has similar EUS findings at a glance. However, by using a high frequency EUS probe, there are some discriminating points between them. This is the result of immunohistochemical staining. The margin of granular cell tumor is somewhat unclear, but the margin of leiomyoma is clear. Therefore, white-to-yellowish surface color, hyperechoic in comparison with surrouding m. echo, and unclear border suggest that this lesion is granular cell tumor.
slide.notesNormalized: at first, the leiomyoma is seen as hypoechoic lesion with clear margin in 2nd layer. granular cell tumor also has similar eus findings at a glance. however, by using a high frequency eus probe, there are some discriminating points between them. this is the result of immunohistochemical staining. the margin of granular cell tumor is somewhat unclear, but the margin of leiomyoma is clear. therefore, white-to-yellowish surface color, hyperechoic in comparison with surrouding m. echo, and unclear border suggest that this lesion is granular cell tumor.
slide.notesHtml:
At first, the leiomyoma is seen as hypoechoic lesion with clear margin in 2nd layer.

Granular cell tumor also has similar EUS findings at a glance.

However, by using a high frequency EUS probe, there are some discriminating points between them.

This is the result of immunohistochemical staining. The margin of granular cell tumor is somewhat unclear, but the margin of leiomyoma is clear.

Therefore, white-to-yellowish surface color, hyperechoic in comparison with surrouding m. echo, and unclear border suggest that this lesion is granular cell tumor.
slide.text: Granular cell tumorf Granular cell tumor vs Leiomyoma Leiomyoma EUS features Sensitivity (%) Specificity (%) PPV (%) NPV (%) Accuracy (%) White-to-yellowish color 85.7 90.0 80.0 93.1 88.6 Hyperechoic in comparison with surrounding m. echo 64.3 93.3 91.8 84.8 84.1 Unclear border 85.7 93.3 85.7 95.3 90.1 Of the above 3 features ≥ one 100 80.0 70.0 100 86.4 ≥ two 85.7 96.7 92.3 93.5 93.2 all 50.0 100 100 81.1 84.1 Kim GH et al. Scand J Gastroenterol 2011;46:142 A A

slide.title: Inflammatory fibrinoid polyp
slide.notes: Inflammatory fibrinoid polyp is seen as hypoechoic lesion with unclear margin in 2nd and/or 3rd layer.
slide.notesNormalized: inflammatory fibrinoid polyp is seen as hypoechoic lesion with unclear margin in 2nd and/or 3rd layer.
slide.notesHtml: Inflammatory fibrinoid polyp is seen as hypoechoic lesion with unclear margin in 2nd and/or 3rd layer.
slide.text: Inflammatory fibrinoid polyp

slide.title: Carcinoid tumor
slide.notes: Carcinoid tumor is usually seen as hypoechoic lesion in 2nd and 3rd layer. First case, the lesion is located only in 2nd layer. Second and third case, the lesions are extended to deep submucosal layer.
slide.notesNormalized: carcinoid tumor is usually seen as hypoechoic lesion in 2nd and 3rd layer. first case, the lesion is located only in 2nd layer. second and third case, the lesions are extended to deep submucosal layer.
slide.notesHtml:
Carcinoid tumor is usually seen as hypoechoic lesion in 2nd and 3rd layer.

First case, the lesion is located only in 2nd layer.

Second and third case, the lesions are extended to deep submucosal layer.
slide.text: Carcinoid tumor

slide.title: Brunner’s gland hyperplasia
slide.notes: Brunner gland hyperplasia on duodenum is seen as hypoechoic lesion with unclear border in 2nd and 3rd layer. Sometimes the lesion includes septate cystic area or focal hyperechoic area.
slide.notesNormalized: brunner gland hyperplasia on duodenum is seen as hypoechoic lesion with unclear border in 2nd and 3rd layer. sometimes the lesion includes septate cystic area or focal hyperechoic area.
slide.notesHtml:
Brunner gland hyperplasia on duodenum is seen as hypoechoic lesion with unclear border in 2nd and 3rd layer.

Sometimes the lesion includes septate cystic area or focal hyperechoic area.
slide.text: Brunner’s gland hyperplasia

slide.title: SELs : 3rd layer
slide.notes: Next, if the lesion is located in the 3rd submucosal layer, the lesion would be diagnosed as lipoma, cyst, AV malformation an so on.
slide.notesNormalized: next, if the lesion is located in the 3rd submucosal layer, the lesion would be diagnosed as lipoma, cyst, av malformation an so on.
slide.notesHtml: Next, if the lesion is located in the 3rd submucosal layer, the lesion would be diagnosed as lipoma, cyst, AV malformation an so on.
slide.text: SELs : 3rd layer Lipoma Cyst Gastritis cystica profunda Lymphangiectasia Arteriovenous malformation Varices Anisakiasis – chronic type

slide.title: Lipoma
slide.notes: Lipoma is seen as hyperechoic lesion with clear margin in 3rd layer. During EUS examination, we can observe the EUS cushion sign (+). Sometimes, the lesion is seen as hypoechoic lesion and so it is misdiagnosed as stromal tumor. In this situation, CT is more helpful to diagnose lipoma.
slide.notesNormalized: lipoma is seen as hyperechoic lesion with clear margin in 3rd layer. during eus examination, we can observe the eus cushion sign (+). sometimes, the lesion is seen as hypoechoic lesion and so it is misdiagnosed as stromal tumor. in this situation, ct is more helpful to diagnose lipoma.
slide.notesHtml:
Lipoma is seen as hyperechoic lesion with clear margin in 3rd layer. During EUS examination, we can observe the EUS cushion sign (+).

Sometimes, the lesion is seen as hypoechoic lesion and so it is misdiagnosed as stromal tumor.

In this situation, CT is more helpful to diagnose lipoma.
slide.text: Lipoma

slide.title: Gastritis cystica profunda
slide.notes: Gastritis cystica profunda is usually seen as anechoic cystic lesion in 3rd layer. However, like this, the solid type gastritis cystica profunda is present and it is misdiagnosed as lymphoma or stromal tumor.
slide.notesNormalized: gastritis cystica profunda is usually seen as anechoic cystic lesion in 3rd layer. however, like this, the solid type gastritis cystica profunda is present and it is misdiagnosed as lymphoma or stromal tumor.
slide.notesHtml:
Gastritis cystica profunda is usually seen as anechoic cystic lesion in 3rd layer.

However, like this, the solid type gastritis cystica profunda is present and it is misdiagnosed as lymphoma or stromal tumor.
slide.text: Gastritis cystica profunda

slide.title: Duplication cyst
slide.notes: Duplication cyst has similar EUS findings like gastritis cystica profunda. The discriminating point is that the lesion has inner 3 or 5 layers in cyst wall. 3rd case is a duplication cyst in duodenum, and it is confirmed by EMR.
slide.notesNormalized: duplication cyst has similar eus findings like gastritis cystica profunda. the discriminating point is that the lesion has inner 3 or 5 layers in cyst wall. 3rd case is a duplication cyst in duodenum, and it is confirmed by emr.
slide.notesHtml:
Duplication cyst has similar EUS findings like gastritis cystica profunda.

The discriminating point is that the lesion has inner 3 or 5 layers in cyst wall.

3rd case is a duplication cyst in duodenum, and it is confirmed by EMR.
slide.text: Duplication cyst

slide.title: Arteriovenous malformation
slide.notes: AV malformation is usually found in the esophagus. The lesion is usually seen as hyperechoic lesion in 3rd submucosal layer. Interestingly, the echo pattern changes into more hypoechoic during examination like hemangioma in the liver. Also, it has peripheral draining vein.
slide.notesNormalized: av malformation is usually found in the esophagus. the lesion is usually seen as hyperechoic lesion in 3rd submucosal layer. interestingly, the echo pattern changes into more hypoechoic during examination like hemangioma in the liver. also, it has peripheral draining vein.
slide.notesHtml:
AV malformation is usually found in the esophagus.

The lesion is usually seen as hyperechoic lesion in 3rd submucosal layer.

Interestingly, the echo pattern changes into more hypoechoic during examination like hemangioma in the liver.

Also, it has peripheral draining vein.
slide.text: Arteriovenous malformation

slide.title: Varices
slide.notes: Varices are seen as serpentine tubular lesion with inner blood flow in 2nd or 3rd layer.
slide.notesNormalized: varices are seen as serpentine tubular lesion with inner blood flow in 2nd or 3rd layer.
slide.notesHtml: Varices are seen as serpentine tubular lesion with inner blood flow in 2nd or 3rd layer.
slide.text: Varices

slide.title: Anisakiasis – chronic type
slide.notes: Chronic anisakiasis is sometimes misdiagnosed as GIST. In my experience, the characteristic findings of chronic anisakiasis are inhomogenous hypoechoic lesions with unclear border in 3rd and/or 4th layer. Inside the lesion, hyperechoic tubular structures suggesting anisakiasis worm are seen.
slide.notesNormalized: chronic anisakiasis is sometimes misdiagnosed as gist. in my experience, the characteristic findings of chronic anisakiasis are inhomogenous hypoechoic lesions with unclear border in 3rd and/or 4th layer. inside the lesion, hyperechoic tubular structures suggesting anisakiasis worm are seen.
slide.notesHtml:
Chronic anisakiasis is sometimes misdiagnosed as GIST.

In my experience, the characteristic findings of chronic anisakiasis are inhomogenous hypoechoic lesions with unclear border in 3rd and/or 4th layer.

Inside the lesion, hyperechoic tubular structures suggesting anisakiasis worm are seen.
slide.text: Anisakiasis – chronic type

slide.title: SELs : 4th layer
slide.notes: Next is the lesion located at the 4th layer. Because we consider the malignant potential, this situation is very important for EUS examiner. This lesion is diagnosed as leiomyoma, GIST, Schwannoma, glomus tumor, or ectopic pancreas.
slide.notesNormalized: next is the lesion located at the 4th layer. because we consider the malignant potential, this situation is very important for eus examiner. this lesion is diagnosed as leiomyoma, gist, schwannoma, glomus tumor, or ectopic pancreas.
slide.notesHtml:
Next is the lesion located at the 4th layer.

Because we consider the malignant potential, this situation is very important for EUS examiner.

This lesion is diagnosed as leiomyoma, GIST, Schwannoma, glomus tumor, or ectopic pancreas.
slide.text: SELs : 4th layer Leiomyoma Schwannoma GIST Glomus tumor Ectopic pancreas

slide.title: Leiomyoma
slide.notes: Leiomyoma usually locates in the cardia and upper body. The lesion is seen as homogenously, hypoechoic lesion with clear border. The echogenicity of leiomyoma is similar to the echogenicity of surrounding m. echo.
slide.notesNormalized: leiomyoma usually locates in the cardia and upper body. the lesion is seen as homogenously, hypoechoic lesion with clear border. the echogenicity of leiomyoma is similar to the echogenicity of surrounding m. echo.
slide.notesHtml:
Leiomyoma usually locates in the cardia and upper body.

The lesion is seen as homogenously, hypoechoic lesion with clear border.

The echogenicity of leiomyoma is similar to the echogenicity of surrounding m. echo.
slide.text: Leiomyoma

slide.title: Schwannoma
slide.notes: Schwannoma is usually found in the body. The lesion is seen as inhomogenously hypoechoic lesion with clear border. The echogenicity of schwannoma is somewhat lower than the echogenicity of surrounding m. echo. Also, the peripheral halo is seen.
slide.notesNormalized: schwannoma is usually found in the body. the lesion is seen as inhomogenously hypoechoic lesion with clear border. the echogenicity of schwannoma is somewhat lower than the echogenicity of surrounding m. echo. also, the peripheral halo is seen.
slide.notesHtml:
Schwannoma is usually found in the body.

The lesion is seen as inhomogenously hypoechoic lesion with clear border.

The echogenicity of schwannoma is somewhat lower than the echogenicity of surrounding m. echo.

Also, the peripheral halo is seen.
slide.text: Schwannoma

slide.title: Benign GIST (very low & low risk)
slide.notes: GIST is usually found in the body. The lesion is seen as inhomogenously hypoechoic lesion with clear border. The echogenicity of GIST is somewhat higher than the echogenicity of surrounding m. echo. Also, the peripheral halo and hyperechogenic foci is seen.
slide.notesNormalized: gist is usually found in the body. the lesion is seen as inhomogenously hypoechoic lesion with clear border. the echogenicity of gist is somewhat higher than the echogenicity of surrounding m. echo. also, the peripheral halo and hyperechogenic foci is seen.
slide.notesHtml:
GIST is usually found in the body.

The lesion is seen as inhomogenously hypoechoic lesion with clear border.

The echogenicity of GIST is somewhat higher than the echogenicity of surrounding m. echo.

Also, the peripheral halo and hyperechogenic foci is seen.
slide.text: Benign GIST (very low & low risk)

slide.title: Malignant GIST (intermediate & high risk)
slide.notes: If the malignant potential of GIST increase, the cystic change, margin lobulation and increased size is usually seen.
slide.notesNormalized: if the malignant potential of gist increase, the cystic change, margin lobulation and increased size is usually seen.
slide.notesHtml: If the malignant potential of GIST increase, the cystic change, margin lobulation and increased size is usually seen.
slide.text: Malignant GIST (intermediate & high risk)

slide.title: GIST vs Leiomyoma
slide.notes: Before, we reported the characteristic EUS findings differentiating GIST from leiomyoma. The frequency of increased echogenicity in comparison with surrounding m. echo, heterogeneity, echogenic foci and marginal halo is higher in GIST. If the lesion has 2 or more features, the sensitivity and specificity for predicting GIST is above 85%.
slide.notesNormalized: before, we reported the characteristic eus findings differentiating gist from leiomyoma. the frequency of increased echogenicity in comparison with surrounding m. echo, heterogeneity, echogenic foci and marginal halo is higher in gist. if the lesion has 2 or more features, the sensitivity and specificity for predicting gist is above 85%.
slide.notesHtml:
Before, we reported the characteristic EUS findings differentiating GIST from leiomyoma.

The frequency of increased echogenicity in comparison with surrounding m. echo, heterogeneity, echogenic foci and marginal halo is higher in GIST.

If the lesion has 2 or more features, the sensitivity and specificity for predicting GIST is above 85%.
slide.text: GIST vs Leiomyoma Kim GH. World J Gastroenterol 2009;15:3376

slide.title: Malignant GIST vs Benign GIST
slide.notes: However, most EUS features were not helpful for predicting the malignant potential of GISTs. On multivariate analysis, only the maximal diameter was an independent predictor.
slide.notesNormalized: however, most eus features were not helpful for predicting the malignant potential of gists. on multivariate analysis, only the maximal diameter was an independent predictor.
slide.notesHtml:
However, most EUS features were not helpful for predicting the malignant potential of GISTs.

On multivariate analysis, only the maximal diameter was an independent predictor.
slide.text: Malignant GIST vs Benign GIST Variables Odds Ratio (95% CI) P Value Size 9.3 (1.6- 53.6) 0.013 Growth 8.7 (0.6-119.8) 0.105 Border 2.3 (0.2- 22.7) 0.490 Homogenicity 2.2 (0.1- 48.0) 0.606 Cystic change 1.4 (0.1- 19.5) 0.800 Kim GH et al. World J Gastroenterol 2009;15:3376 Optimal size for predicting malignant GISTs was 35 mm. The sensitivity and specificity were 92.3% and 78.8%.

slide.title: DDx points in mesenchymal tumors
slide.text: DDx points in mesenchymal tumors

slide.title: Ectopic pancreas
slide.notes: Last case is the ectopic pancreas. The characteristic EUS findings are -----.
slide.notesNormalized: last case is the ectopic pancreas. the characteristic eus findings are -----.
slide.notesHtml:
Last case is the ectopic pancreas.

The characteristic EUS findings are -----.
slide.text:
Ectopic pancreas Characteristic EUS features Indistinct border Margin lobulation Anechoic duct-like structures Mural growth pattern Location within two or more layers
Kim GH et al. J Gastroenterol Hepatol 2011;26:1441 Kim GH et al. Word J Gastroenterol 2010;16:4589

slide.title: Superficial type
slide.notes: I classified the EUS findings of ectopic pancreas into two types: superficial type and deep type. In superficial type, the lesion is located in 2nd or 3rd layer. In deep type, the lesion is located in 3rd, 4th, 5th layer. Therefore, the deep type ectopic pancreas is often misdiagnosed as GIST.
slide.notesNormalized: i classified the eus findings of ectopic pancreas into two types: superficial type and deep type. in superficial type, the lesion is located in 2nd or 3rd layer. in deep type, the lesion is located in 3rd, 4th, 5th layer. therefore, the deep type ectopic pancreas is often misdiagnosed as gist.
slide.notesHtml:
I classified the EUS findings of ectopic pancreas into two types: superficial type and deep type.

In superficial type, the lesion is located in 2nd or 3rd layer.

In deep type, the lesion is located in 3rd, 4th, 5th layer. Therefore, the deep type ectopic pancreas is often misdiagnosed as GIST.
slide.text: Superficial type Deep type

slide.title: J Gastroenterol Hepatol 2008;23:556-566
slide.notes: This slide shows the summary of characteristic EUS features of each SEL. Although EUS is a moderately accurate modality for SELs, EUS is operator-dependent. The accuracy for hypoechoic lesions in 3rd/4th layer is only 50-60%.
slide.notesNormalized: this slide shows the summary of characteristic eus features of each sel. although eus is a moderately accurate modality for sels, eus is operator-dependent. the accuracy for hypoechoic lesions in 3rd/4th layer is only 50-60%.
slide.notesHtml:
This slide shows the summary of characteristic EUS features of each SEL.

Although EUS is a moderately accurate modality for SELs, EUS is operator-dependent.

The accuracy for hypoechoic lesions in 3rd/4th layer is only 50-60%.
slide.text: Limitation of EUS Moderately accurate method for evaluating SELs, but operator-dependent Only 50-60% accuracy for hypoechoic lesions in 3rd/4th layer J Gastroenterol Hepatol 2008;23:556-566

slide.title: Standardization process of EUS image
slide.notes: Therefore, I tried to make a computer-aided diagnostic method to describe EUS features more objectively. By the help of computer engineers, I can standardize the EUS image like this.
slide.notesNormalized: therefore, i tried to make a computer-aided diagnostic method to describe eus features more objectively. by the help of computer engineers, i can standardize the eus image like this.
slide.notesHtml:
Therefore, I tried to make a computer-aided diagnostic method to describe EUS features more objectively.

By the help of computer engineers, I can standardize the EUS image like this.
slide.text: Standardization process of EUS image Kim GH et al. BMC Gastroenterol 2014;14:7

slide.title: An example of digital image analysis
slide.titleNormalized: an example of digital image analysis
slide.notes: As a result, the echogenicity and heterogeneity can be expressed as the mean and SD of the brightness values
slide.notesNormalized: as a result, the echogenicity and heterogeneity can be expressed as the mean and sd of the brightness values
slide.notesHtml: As a result, the echogenicity and heterogeneity can be expressed as the mean and SD of the brightness values
slide.text: An example of digital image analysis Kim GH et al. BMC Gastroenterol 2014;14:7

slide.title: Tmean & TSD of mesenchymal tumors
slide.notes: Mean and SD of the brightness values is higher in GIST than in leiomyoma and schwannoma.
slide.notesNormalized: mean and sd of the brightness values is higher in gist than in leiomyoma and schwannoma.
slide.notesHtml: Mean and SD of the brightness values is higher in GIST than in leiomyoma and schwannoma.
slide.text: Tmean & TSD of mesenchymal tumors Kim GH et al. BMC Gastroenterol 2014;14:7 GIST (n = 50) Leiomyoma (n = 6) Schwannoma (n = 9) P value1) Tmean 82.8±22.5 39.8±18.9 47.0±12.0 < 0.001 T2) a b b TSD 83.5±14.4 54.3±21.7 58.3±17.5 < 0.001 T2) a b b 1) Statistical significances were tested by one-way analysis of variances among groups. 2) The same letters indicate non-significant difference between groups based on Turkey's multiple comparison test.

slide.title: Sensitivity, specificity, positive/negative predictive values & accuracy differentiating GISTs from non-GIST tumors
slide.titleNormalized: sensitivity, specificity, positive/negative predictive values & accuracy differentiating gists from non-gist tumors
slide.notes: The sensitivity and specificity were almost optimized when the critical values of Tmean and TSD were 65 and 75. If a tumor has at least 1 of these 2 findings, the sensitivity of 94%, specificity of 80%, positive predictive value of 94%, negative predictive value of 80%, and accuracy of 90.8% for predicting GIST.
slide.notesNormalized: the sensitivity and specificity were almost optimized when the critical values of tmean and tsd were 65 and 75. if a tumor has at least 1 of these 2 findings, the sensitivity of 94%, specificity of 80%, positive predictive value of 94%, negative predictive value of 80%, and accuracy of 90.8% for predicting gist.
slide.notesHtml:
The sensitivity and specificity were almost optimized when the critical values of Tmean and TSD were 65 and 75.

If a tumor has at least 1 of these 2 findings, the sensitivity of 94%, specificity of 80%, positive predictive value of 94%, negative predictive value of 80%, and accuracy of 90.8% for predicting GIST.

slide.title: Conclusions
slide.text: Conclusions A SEL is commonly found during endoscopy. EUS allow for improved characterization of SELs aid in narrowing differential diagnosis However, EUS is not a perfect examination for SELs. Knowledge and experience is power. Computer-aided analysis will be helpful for objective diagnosis. EUS

slide.title: Thank you for your attention!
